free_text.Learning outcomes: This course is the follow up practical of Advanced Biomicroscopy I, which is a prerequisite to be eglibile to participate in this course. Most of the theoretical aspects of Advanced Biomicroscopy I will be covered practically. The aim of the course is to make the students familiar with modern light-microscopes which are used for state of the art research in the field of life-science. A variety of microscopes like e.g. wide-field light-microscopes point-scanning-confocal and multi-beam confocal microscopes will be used. Besides microscopy technology student are supposed to learn how to image biological specimens and advanced imaging concepts like Fluorescence Recovery After Photobleaching (FRAP) or Förster Resonance Energy Transfer (FRET).
